{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3347868,"name":"Matan","username":"Neener","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/neener/{size}/214272_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T17:04:19.814Z","cooked":"

For our battery mount we would like to use a strap but it protrudes outside of our frame parameter? Is this legal?

20240330_1002371920×2560 546 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-30T17:04:19.814Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":274,"readers_count":273,"score":124.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460721,"topic_slug":"strap-in-frame-parameter","display_username":"Matan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/1/9/198d3b60ba054abdc3c2a195d1487b083fec8f7c.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63997,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/strap-in-frame-parameter/460721/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3347869,"name":"","username":"IanSzalai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ianszalai/{size}/210636_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T17:08:11.905Z","cooked":"

I would argue that this is a minor protrusion, so it should be legal. That being said, not being able to replace your battery without taking off the bumper seems ill-advised.

As stated above, this seems to be a minor protrusion that is allowed under Rule R101:

image1103×143 54.8 KB

IanSzalai:

not being able to replace your battery without taking off the bumper seems ill-advised.

It looks like the strap can still be unclipped and moved out of the way with the bumpers on.

ah I somehow missed that, I should stick to software

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-30T17:25:44.932Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":149.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460721,"topic_slug":"strap-in-frame-parameter","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58509,"username":"FRCAlum","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/90ced4/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49699,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3255A"},"post_url":"/t/strap-in-frame-parameter/460721/4","custom_user_title":"3255A","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"hugs","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3347892,"name":"Doug Frisk","username":"Doug_Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T17:55:20.282Z","cooked":"

Because the strap can move relative to the frame, some robot inspectors may call it “articulated.” Personally I’d say it offers no competitive advantage but may not secure the battery as well as it should.

I’d suggest a box for the battery with higher walls. As it is, a heavy hit could easily cause that battery to come lose or crack against the frame rail.

A strap is so different from any of the examples of a minor protrusion that I don’t believe it can be considered as such.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-30T19:12:49.393Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":31.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460721,"topic_slug":"strap-in-frame-parameter","display_username":"Max Vrany","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15810,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Robot Inspector/FLL Tournament Director"},"post_url":"/t/strap-in-frame-parameter/460721/6","custom_user_title":"FRC Robot Inspector/FLL Tournament Director","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3347923,"name":"Gordon Walsh","username":"GordonW","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-30T19:28:17.245Z","cooked":"

Most RIs will be more interested in keeping you and your robot safe than trying to nitpick on the rules. That said, personally I don’t see the strap as being counted as a “minor” protrusion like the listed examples.

However, if you had something on either side of the strap that was the same thickness, e.g. a thin piece of plastic super glued on, your FRAME PERIMETER would technically pass around them and even the most literal rule stickler would have to accept it. Since the gap between the actual chassis and this FRAME PERIMETER is so small, it shouldn’t affect any other rules, such as bumper gap or max perimeter.

Another option would be to just mount a loop or ring to the top of the frame rail that the strap could pass through or attach to, instead of going around the whole frame rail.

I think this is the most “technically correct” answer so far. Also, I imagine during gameplay that strap is getting rubbed between the bumpers and the frame and potentially wearing to failure.
